== Exercise: Define key bindings
=== Create binding context entries
Select the _Binding Contexts_ entry in your application model. Define a new entry with the `org.eclipse.ui.contexts.dialogAndWindow` ID. As name use "Windows and Dialogs".
image::exercise_keybindings10.png" scale="40[How to add the Binding Context Entries,pdfwidth=60%]
Afterwards add the following sub-entries:
=== Binding context entries
ID Name
org.eclipse.ui.contexts.dialog Dialogs
org.eclipse.ui.contexts.window Windows
The resulting entry is depicted in the following screenshot.
image::exercise_keybindings20.png" scale="40[How to add the Binding Context Entries,pdfwidth=60%]
The name attribute of a binding context entry is not allowed to be empty.
=== Create key bindings for a BindingContext
Create a key binding for your Save command to the
M1 S
shortcut. Afterwards create a keybinding for your Exit command to the
M1 X
shortcut.
The required entries are depicted in the following screenshots.
image::tutorial_bindingtable10.png" scale="35[How to add the Binding Context Entries,pdfwidth=60%]
image::tutorial_bindingtable20.png" scale="40[How to add the Binding Context Entries,pdfwidth=60%]
Run your program and test it.
